Package gym

Class GymManager

java.lang.Object
gym.GymManager
public class GymManager extends Object
This class is the user interface for Gym Manager. The client can input commands via the console / terminal to interact with the database and the fitness classes. See run() for more details on valid commands.

**Please Note: There is only one memberDataBase instance.**
Author:
Hasnain Ali, Carolette Saguil

  • Constructor Details

    • GymManager

      public GymManager()
      Default constructor; not used.

  • Method Details

    • addMember

      private void addMember(String[] lineParts, MemberDatabase memberDatabase)
      Adds a member to the member database. Fails if: Date of birth is invalid, date of birth is in the future, member is younger than 18 years old, expiration date is invalid, location is invalid, or if member is already in the database.
      Parameters:
      lineParts - String array for command inputted; allows for easier parsing of command.
      memberDatabase - The member database that was created for all current members. Only one exists.

    • removeMember

      private void removeMember(String[] lineParts, MemberDatabase memberDatabase)
      Removes a member from the database. If the member is not in the database, they will fail to be removed. If they are, they will be removed successfully.
      Parameters:
      lineParts - String array for command inputted; allows for easier parsing of command.
      memberDatabase - The member database that was created for all current members.

    • instantiateFitnessClasses

      private void instantiateFitnessClasses(FitnessClass[] fitnessClasses)
      FitnessClass array is instantiated and made here.
        fitnessClass[0] = Pilates, fitnessClass[1] = Spinning, fitnessClass[2] = Cardio
      Parameters:
      fitnessClasses - Array consisting of all fitness classes. fitnessClass[0] = Pilates, fitnessClass[1] = Spinning, fitnessClass[2] = Cardio

    • returnClassIndex

      private int returnClassIndex(String className)
      Based on className, the appropriate index for the class is returned.
      Parameters:
      className - The name of the class to return the index from.
      Returns:
      The index of the class based on the className. -1 is the class was not found.

    • checkInMember

      private void checkInMember(String[] lineParts, MemberDatabase memberDatabase, FitnessClass[] fitnessClasses)
      Checks a member into a particular fitness class. The class must exist, they must have a valid date of birth, exist in the member database, not have an expired membership, not have already checked in, and not have a time conflict with another class.
      Parameters:
      lineParts - String array for command inputted; allows for easier parsing of command.
      memberDatabase - The member database that was created for all current members.
      fitnessClasses - Array consisting of all fitness classes. fitnessClass[0] = Pilates, fitnessClass[1] = Spinning, fitnessClass[2] = Cardio

    • dropClass

      private void dropClass(String[] lineParts, MemberDatabase memberDatabase, FitnessClass[] fitnessClasses)
      Drops a particular member from the class. They must be in the class, have a valid date of birth, and be wanting to drop a class that exists.
      Parameters:
      lineParts - String array for command inputted; allows for easier parsing of command.
      memberDatabase - The member database that was created for all current members.
      fitnessClasses - Array consisting of all fitness classes. fitnessClass[0] = Pilates, fitnessClass[1] = Spinning, fitnessClass[2] = Cardio

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts running the Gym Manager UI blocking while waiting for valid commands. Using the String.split() method, this method parses any input given to it via standard input using Java Scanner. Valid inputs are as follows:

      ***Please Note do not include | in your commands, these are simply here for readability purposes***

      • A | First_Name | Last_Name | Date_Of_Birth | Expiration_Date | Location
        • Appends member to database
      • R | First_Name | Last_Name | Date_Of_Birth
        • Removes member from the database.
      • P
        • Print current Member Database
      • PC
        • Print current Member Database sorted by county
      • PN
        • Print current Member Database sorted by last name, first name
      • PD
        • Print current Member Database sorted by membership expiration dates.
      • S
        • Print fitness class schedule
      • C | Class_Name | First_Name | Last_Name | Date_Of_Birth
        • Check a person in the database into a particular existing fitness class
      • D | Class_Name | First_Name | Last_Name | Date_Of_Birth
        • Drops member from a particular fitness class.
      • Q
        • Quits/Terminates user interface (kills program).
